intro: Galium beckhausianum, commonly known as Beckhaus's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer.
